you.re_just_as_sane_as_i_am: 😂😂😂 I had no idea there are non vegetarians who live in such an obnoxiously entitled way and vegetarians who tolerate to that level. Here I am with friends with whom I always have to order vegetarian food myself even though I don't want to just to make sure they are comfortable(and the real reason is so that they don't FUCKING OSTRACISE ME AND REFUSE TO SIT WITH ME even when I'm the one treating them). And I have one exception who doesn't put me through that and doesn't claim she can't tolerate having to see or smell non veg food or she'll vomit so I can actually have the plate at the same table and actually spend my money on what I want to eat without being treated like an untouchable. Also, I never dare to take a bite from my vegetarian friends' food because they will then "have to" abandon the whole plate even if I picked up one bite in one corner with my clean fork that hadn't been put in my mouth yet, and then get pissed about it. I'm not saying all this to complain or in a petty attempt to equalise or something. I get that this is comedy and probably legit in some ridiculously accepting and progressive circles at the other extreme end, and I found this effing hilarious. I wish I could have vegetarian friends like you. I would never exploit your generosity n tolerance. :') 😭😭😭😭😭 I have reached a point where I, a hardcore vegetarian, has just come to terms with the sad reality if having to spend money in vegetarian food if I go out to eat with friends. 😭😭😭 It may not seem like much to you but it's acute misery to me, okay. Specially if another table orders something non veg n I look at it longingly as the waiter passes me by. I need new friends, period. But I probably won't get any more like you or my one tolerant friend, here
